TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant left GPE for GPE in DATE . After his judicial rehabilitation in DATE he started living partly in GPE and partly in GPE . According to the applicant , he spent the major part of DATE in GPE . On DATE he registered his permanent residence at his friend ’s address in GPE . He remained registered at this address until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim for restitution of his father ’s and uncle ’s property under LAW of DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim on the ground that at the relevant time he had not permanently resided within the territory of the former NORP and GPE as required by Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW .

CARDINAL . ORG established that a registered letter sent on DATE could not be delivered as at that time nobody had lived at the applicant ’s address in PERSON . ORG had before it also a certificate in which the competent NORP authority confirmed that the applicant had registered his main abode ( Hauptwohnung ) in PERSON since DATE . The accompanying letter by the NORP vice - consul to GPE explained that , unlike in GPE , no distinction was made between permanent and temporary residence in GPE . The letter further stated that under NORP law the main abode was the place of residence preponderantly used by the person concerned in GPE , and that there was no obligation under NORP law to terminate its registration when a person spent the major part of DATE abroad . The vice - consul expressed the view that in case that the applicant ’s stay in GPE exceeded DATE a year , his residence there could , theoretically , be regarded as permanent within the meaning of ORG of DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In its decision ORG referred also to a police report according to which the applicant had not effectively established his permanent residence in GPE . ORG concluded , with reference to LAW CARDINAL ) and Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG of DATE and to the relevant case - law and administrative practice , that the applicant did not meet the permanent residence requirement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to review ORG decision . He alleged that since DATE he had resided at various places in GPE and submitted witness statements to this effect . The applicant further explained that several times a year he went to GPE where he was undergoing cancer therapy .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the administrative decision challenged by the applicant . It noted that by the date of expiry of the deadline for lodging his claim on DATE the applicant had not permanently resided within the former NORP and GPE as required by Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW .

CARDINAL . ORG recalled , in particular , that under Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG of DATE citizens can not permanently reside at CARDINAL address at the same time . As the applicant failed to terminate the registration of his main abode in GPE prior to the registration of his permanent residence in GPE , his stay in the then GPE was to be regarded as temporary . Reference was made to the relevant case - law and to the practice of ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG further held that the applicant had submitted no evidence indicating that his abode in GPE met the requirements of a permanent residence within the meaning of LAW ) of ORG . Moreover , a police report before the court indicated that the applicant ’s registration in PERSON had been of a formal nature .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to re - examine the case as there was no remedy available against ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW of DATE ( PERSON o úprave vlastníckych vzťahov k pôde a inému poľnohospodárskemu majetku ) read as follows .

“ CARDINAL . Persons entitled to claim the restitution of property are nationals of the NORP and GPE with permanent residence within its territory whose land and buildings forming a part of an agricultural estate were transferred to the ORG or to other legal persons during the period between CARDINAL DATE and DATE in the manner set out in Section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . In case of decease , prior to the expiry of the time - limit laid down in LAW , of the person whose real property was transferred to the ORG or to other legal persons during the period between CARDINAL DATE and DATE in the manner set out in Section CARDINAL ) ... the following natural persons are entitled to restitution provided that they are nationals of the NORP and GPE and permanently reside within its territory : ...
c ) children ... of the persons mentioned in paragraph CARDINAL ...
e ) siblings of the persons mentioned in paragraph CARDINAL and , in case of decease of CARDINAL of the siblings , his or her children . ”
“ CARDINAL . Any claim for restitution of property under LAW shall be filed not later than on DATE ... The right to restitution of property shall lapse when the claim was not filed in time ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of ORG of DATE ( PERSON o hlásení a evidovaní pobytu občanov ) read as follows .

“ CARDINAL . A citizen ’s permanent residence is the place where he or she permanently lives , that is , as a rule , where his or her family or parents live , or the place where the citizen ’s home or occupation is located . ...
CARDINAL . The stay of citizens permanently living abroad within the territory of GPE shall be considered as being temporary . ”
“ CARDINAL . Every citizen shall have his or her permanent residence registered ; citizens may not have permanent residence registered at CARDINAL place at the same time . ”

CARDINAL . NORP In accordance with the established practice , the permanent residence requirement has not been complied with when a person fails to show that the registration of his or her permanent residence abroad was terminated before he or she registered as permanently residing on the territory of the former GPE or , as the case may be , on the territory of CARDINAL of its successor GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP Under the practice of ORG , a person may register as permanently residing in GPE only after the termination of his or her permanent residence abroad . Otherwise the residence of such a person in GPE is considered as being temporary until the termination of the registration abroad .
